135.content:
Laurence, whom calls himself Lore for short, is the owner and operator of a huge tech company called Lore Enterprises. They make all the top of the line high tech gadgetry for everyone from the military to civilian interests and is among the richest men alive. Only Lore has a dark secret of which only his wife and a few others know... He is the last of the great mad scientists of old. He truly loves his wife, Barbara and hopes to produce a male to whom to pass on his knowledge so his legacy may live on.

He is highly protective of his daughter Bibi as she carries the genes to also produce a male offspring with the power of mad science. However, his wife secretly wishes Bibi only produces daughters for the same reason. She too is very protective which leaves Bibi to pity any young suitor who may summon the courage to come to her door.

Bibi is aware her father has power but assumes it is magic. Everything her heart desires is but a call to dad or mom away but she remains humble due to a strict ladies code of conduct her mother insists upon...
135.title: Dad has a secret too.

choices: Meeting Gina and Joe at school.
1351.content:
Living in the lot behind the Blocksbergs is the Mage family. Your mother and father respect them and maintain a fair relationship. Bibi is good friends with Gina Mage (14) who had just returned after vanishing for a year to who knows where. She had forest brown hair and green eyes. She was kind and patient but a bit of a tomboy.

Bibi has a good relationship with her younger brother, Joe Mage (13) who is a very strong and talented athlete with high hopes to enter the Olympics someday. He had sand blond hair and hazel eyes. He was kind and gentle, ready to help anyone any way he could. Bibi's mother had often hinted she take her relationship with him further, something neither Bibi or Joe saw happening anytime soon.

She has a decent relationship with Tia and Ina Mage (7) who have magic at a young age and seem to specialize in teleportation which they use to lightheartedly play jokes on Joe and others. Bibi was usually bemused by their antics as all of them were harmless due to their general innocence and lack of mischievous imagination. Both had long forest brown hair but Ina had green eyes while Tia had hazel eyes.

Bibi has a very good relationship with their mother, Mona Mage (35) who is an expert in combat magic and offers tutoring services to young witches with mad scientist brothers and or fathers. Her mother, Ella Mist is the head witch who had long black hair and piercing green eyes.

Bibi has no relationship with the father, Geo Mage (35) who is the head mad scientist. He is rarely around and more rarely seen by her. She had been told that he believes his long absences will ease the tensions with your mom and the witch community. He sees it as protecting the family, Bibi sees it in another way. He was tall and muscular with short sand brown hair and hazel eyes. He gives Bibi the creeps, she is thankful she so rarely sees him.

Gina Mage had recently graduated at the top of her class at Cauldron Academy all girls boarding school where she learned witchcraft. Bibi's mother had considered asking her mother to train Bibi.
1351.title: Meet the neighbors.

13511.content:
Bibi was happy to see Gina back from Cauldron Academy. It bothered her not to tell Joe where she had gone but her family had their reasons to keep him in the dark and she respected them. They met up during lunch which was when the entire school mingled with each other. "How was your year, Gina?" Smiling, she said.

"It was incredible!" Beaming, Gina replied. "If you think you know everything there is to know about magic, buckle up when you go there." She then whispered, "Joe is going nuts not knowing, we are telling him everything tonight."

Bibi giggled at that. "I wonder how he will take it." Bemused, she said.

"Why not come over and see for yourself?" Kindly, Gina offered. "It should be interesting to watch, especially if he asks to see some proof."

Bibi giggled at that. Witchcraft was generally a girl thing but boys had a magic all their own though they called it mad science. Where this came from was beyond her as both powers were basically the same. Her guess it was a way to separate the genders.

"I'd love to come." Smiling, Bibi said. "Mom wants me to ask your mom for some lessons anyway."

Gina smiled. "Come around five o'clock." Kindly, she said.

"Hey, guys." Walking up, Joe said. "What are you talking about?"

"Just catching up." Lightly, Gina said. "We'll be catching up tonight over dinner."

Bibi giggled. "I'll be coming over, Gina invited me."

Joe smiled. "See you around five, then." Kindly, he said.

He then walked back to his own group of friends as Gina sighed. "Dad came for a visit this morning." Her smile faltering, she said. "He said that Joe is very close to discovering his spark, his power of mad science."

Bibi sighed as well. "Only he is also close to discovering his magical flame." Whispering, she said. "What is taking him so long? I knew of my power all of my life."

"It is because, for now, all of Joe's power is focused within his attributes." Serious, Gina explained. "He has known of his power all of his life but he believes it is his physical strength." She shook her head. "Mad scientists do not tell their children of their powers until they are confident they are mentally ready for the responsibility the power holds. It is why they see witches as reckless...it's ironic, if you think about it."

Bibi winced. "I see..."
13511.title: Meeting Gina and Joe at school.

choices: they were accused of withcraft in public
135111.content:
As Gina and Bibi entered their classroom, principal Riverdale was there and two police officers.
They seem to wait for someone. And as the two girls entered it was clear that police was waiting for them.
The girls had to follow the principal into her office accompanied by two police offers.
“What is wrong?” asked Gina.
135111.title: something happens at school.

1351112.content:
"Mad scientist recruiters are coming to this school." Frowning, principal Holly Riverdale replied. "They will be targeting young witches, trying to sway them into joining their ranks which is why we called you two in."

"What do you mean?" Worried, Bibi asked.

"She is unaware?" Surprised, the first officer asked.

Holly sighed. "As you know, Gina's grandmother is the head witch in this region." Serious, she explained. "Only her job is to rule over adult witches." She turned to Bibi. "Your mother is the head witch in this region who rules over teenage witches."

Bibi's eyes went wide. "She is what?!" Startled, she asked.

"That is why the head witch has a council." Serious, the second officer explained. "All of them are head witches ruling over a different aspect of the witching world."

"We are warning you both that these recruiters can and will approach you." Darkly, Holly said. "If Gina is convinced to become a mad scientist, she will be next in line to take the chaotic throne over her brother, Joe."

"If Bibi is convinced to become a mad scientist, her family will lose their royal title of which they had carried for over a thousand years." Serious, the first guard said. "This is a dire situation... keep on your toes."

Both Gina and Bibi gulped. "We will do our best." Bibi said.

After they were excused, Bibi let out a long sigh. "I can't believe my mother is the head witch ruling over teenage witches."

"Neither can I, really." Wincing, Gina said. "I always thought my grandmother was the boss over all witches."

"Well, I am the over all leader but its a great responsibility." Startling you, Ella said. She had appeared in front of you as if she had just walked in from a hall. She was tall and slender with long black hair and piercing emerald green eyes. "The other head witches and I work as equals, creating and modifying laws to maintain the peace in these uncertain times."

"Why was I not told?" Wincing, Bibi asked.

Ella smiled kindly. "You did not ask." Simply, she replied. "Lesson three, item two."

Bibi sighed. "To get the right answers, ask the right questions."

Ella smiled then vanished.

135111233.content:
With a wicked, mischievous grin, Bibi and Gina cast their spells only to find it did not work though the two police officers knew magic was used. They both merely shook their heads at the two surprised girls. "You are not dealing with amateurs, ladies." Bemused, the first officer said. "Jon and I immune to magic and mad science."

"Hank is right, girls." Grinning, Jon said. "Also, it is frowned upon to use magic in public places, it could get you a detention or two."

"We'll let this one slide." Smiling, Hank said. "Just bear in mind that we are here for your protection, not everyone gets such advantages."

"Is my brother and twin sisters getting similar protection?" Worried, Gina asked.

"Joe has been receiving protection for several days now." Calmly, Jon replied. "Your father is obsessively protective of him."

"That's ironic as i rarely see him around." Frowning, Gina said.

"He is always a lot closer than you might think, young lady." Serious, Hank replied. He then grinned. "Also do not worry about the bathrooms. One will be inside with you while the other guards the entrance."

This surprised and disturbed both Gina and Bibi. Seeing their expressions, Jon raised his arm and they saw it go through a student as if he were a ghost. "We are invisible and non-corporeal until we are needed to protect either or both of you." Smiling, he said. "Only you two are aware of our presence."

Bibi rolled her eyes. "Fantastic..."
135111233.title: Not dealing with amateurs.

choices: Bibi is happy for her mom.
1351112332.content:
After school Bibi marched into Barbra's study where she was not surprised to find her waiting for her. "Yes, the school informed me that they filled you in on your linage." Calmly, she said. "It was on a need to know basis and, until today, you did not need to know and for good reason."

"To keep me humble." Frowning, Bibi guessed.

Barbra shook her head. "No, I raised you to be humble." Serious, she said. "It is against the law of both witches and mad scientists to use their power in the presence of those unaware of their linage."

"What is that supposed to mean?" Taken back, Bibi asked.

"It should be obvious." Calmly, Barbra replied. "Both Lore and I want your first love to be because of who you are not what one can again from the relationship."

"It goes far deeper than just that, my dear." Startling Bibi, Lore said.

Bibi turned to see Lore appear in the room. "What is this all about, dad?" Wincing, she asked. "You are both starting to worry me."

"Elementary, my ever cautious offspring." smiling, Lore said. "both you and your dear friend, Gina are in a position of both political and magical power. You are both a worthy prize to any suitor and/ or any school regardless of its power affiliation."

"So, I'm a key chess piece in a political game between mad scientists and witches." Frowning, Bibi said. "Lovely..."

"You could see it like that." Smiling, Barbra said. "However, it is not as bad as you fear, just stay on your toes." she then blushed. "There is another issue to consider..."

"Indeed?" Curious, dad asked.

Barbra nodded. "I'm pregnant... you are going to have a brother."

Dad beamed with pride and delight.
1351112332.title: Bibi questions her mom after school.

1352.content:
Bibi had a close friend, Cindy Bauer, who lived in the neighborhood of the Blacksburg’s.
Both girls were attending the same school and class.
Cindy as well as Bibi just turned 12. Today was Cindy’s birthday actually. She had organized a party and Bibi was invited but she was sure her parents would not allow her to spend the evening there…
Bibi will turn 12 soon and knows that she might not need a babysitter anymore, but her parents were strict on that…..
But anyhow Bibi will find a way to sneak over to her friend.
1352.title: Meet Bibi's friends.

info.brief_description: Tales of a young witch girl
info.description: we have a young girl named Bibi, who is a witch
